alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Renville; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:13PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Renville, Yellow Medicine and Chippewa Counties. .The combination of snow melt runoff and forecast rainfall will continue to increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 889.1 feet, Flood waters begin to flow over Dikes Road and into the natural diversion that starts upstream of Granite Falls...water flows west and south of the city, reentering the river just below highway 212. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 884.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 888.6 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 885.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 888.9 feet on 07/02/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
